trans-unit.source: Import data into Machine Learning Studio from a local file | Microsoft Azure
trans-unit.target: Import data into Machine Learning Studio from a local file | Microsoft Azure

trans-unit.source: How to import your training data Azure Machine Learning Studio from a local file.
trans-unit.target: How to import your training data Azure Machine Learning Studio from a local file.

trans-unit.source: Import your training data into Azure Machine Learning Studio from a local file
trans-unit.target: Import your training data into Azure Machine Learning Studio from a local file

trans-unit.source: To use your own data in Machine Learning Studio, you can upload a data file ahead of time from your local hard drive to create a dataset module in your workspace.
trans-unit.target: To use your own data in Machine Learning Studio, you can upload a data file ahead of time from your local hard drive to create a dataset module in your workspace.

trans-unit.source: Import data from a local file
trans-unit.target: Import data from a local file

trans-unit.source: You can import data from a local hard drive by doing the following:
trans-unit.target: You can import data from a local hard drive by doing the following:

trans-unit.source: Click **+NEW** at the bottom of the Machine Learning Studio window.
trans-unit.target: Click **+NEW** at the bottom of the Machine Learning Studio window.

trans-unit.source: Select **DATASET** and **FROM LOCAL FILE**.
trans-unit.target: Select **DATASET** and **FROM LOCAL FILE**.

trans-unit.source: In the **Upload a new dataset** dialog, browse to the file you want to upload
trans-unit.target: In the **Upload a new dataset** dialog, browse to the file you want to upload

trans-unit.source: Enter a name, identify the data type, and optionally enter a description.
trans-unit.target: Enter a name, identify the data type, and optionally enter a description.

trans-unit.source: A description is recommended - it allows you to record any characteristics about the data that you will want to remember when using the data in the future.
trans-unit.target: A description is recommended - it allows you to record any characteristics about the data that you will want to remember when using the data in the future.

trans-unit.source: The checkbox **This is the new version of an existing dataset** allows you to update an existing dataset with new data.
trans-unit.target: The checkbox **This is the new version of an existing dataset** allows you to update an existing dataset with new data.

trans-unit.source: Just click this checkbox and then enter the name of an existing dataset.
trans-unit.target: Just click this checkbox and then enter the name of an existing dataset.

trans-unit.source: During upload, you will see a message that your file is being uploaded.
trans-unit.target: During upload, you will see a message that your file is being uploaded.

trans-unit.source: Upload time will depend on the size of your data and the speed of your connection to the service.
trans-unit.target: Upload time will depend on the size of your data and the speed of your connection to the service.

trans-unit.source: If you know the file will take a long time, you can do other things inside Machine Learning Studio while you wait.
trans-unit.target: If you know the file will take a long time, you can do other things inside Machine Learning Studio while you wait.

trans-unit.source: However, closing the browser will cause the data upload to fail.
trans-unit.target: However, closing the browser will cause the data upload to fail.

trans-unit.source: Once your data is uploaded, it's stored in a dataset module and is available to any experiment in your workspace.
trans-unit.target: Once your data is uploaded, it's stored in a dataset module and is available to any experiment in your workspace.

trans-unit.source: You can find the dataset, along with all the pre-loaded sample datasets, in the **Saved Datasets** list in the module palette when you're editing an experiment.
trans-unit.target: You can find the dataset, along with all the pre-loaded sample datasets, in the **Saved Datasets** list in the module palette when you're editing an experiment.

trans-unit.source: You can drag and drop the dataset in the experiment canvas when you want to use the data set for the further analytics and machine learning.
trans-unit.target: You can drag and drop the dataset in the experiment canvas when you want to use the data set for the further analytics and machine learning.
